MEMBERS OF THE BOARD ROY L. COCHRAN Governor HARRY R. SWANSON Secretary of State RAY C. JOHNSON State Auditor DR. T. W. BASS (Died Aug. 21, 1939) State Treasurer JOHN HAVEKOST (Appointed Aug. 26, 1939) State Treasurer WM. H. SMITH State Tax Commfe3ioner LEGAL ADVISER TO THE BOARD WALTER R. JOHNSON Attorney General EDWIN VAIL Assistant TAX COMMISSIONERS OF NEBRASKA The position of State Tax Commissioner was created by the Con - stitution of 1920. Prior thereto the work was performed by a secretary to the State Board of Equalization and Assessment, the Tax Commis - sioner being made a member of the board. Those who have served as Commissioner under the constitutional provision are: NAME COUNTY SERVED W. H. OSBORNE—Custer April 25, 1921, to April 18, 1923 WM. H. SMITH Seward April 18, 1923, to January 12,1925 T. E. WILLIAMS-—Hamilton January 12, 1925, to January 8, 1929 HARRY W. SCOTT. Lancaster January 8, 1929, to December 1, 1930 WM. H. SMITH Seward January 8, 193 L to OFFICE STAFF—I 939 A. W. Hodges Chief Clerk Florence Thomas Stenographer Edna Wellman Distribution Clerk Irene Walters Tax Clerk Alice McCormick Bookkeeper Minnie Adsit Clerk-Bookkeeper Division of Purchase and Supplies J. R. Farris Purchasing Agent Helen Werner Stenographer Mary Burke Clerk

LETTER OF TRANSMITTAL OFFICE OF STATE TAX COMMISSIONER - LINCOLN, NEBRASKA December 1, 1939. Honorable JR. L. Cochran, Governor of Nebraska, Lincoln. ¦¦¦¦¦ ' i ..'¦'¦';' ' My dear Governor: There is being transmitted to you herewith the annual report of the State Board of Equalization and Assessment, and the State Tax Com - missioner, for the year 1939. . In addition to tables showing the result of the general assessment jf various classes of property for the current year, the report carries a statement showing the expenditures from all sources and for all pur - poses, as shown by the records of the department, a statement showing the gasoline tax- collections and disbursements to counties, and a state - ment showing the property taxes levied by counties for the state and its various subdivisions. Respectfully submitted, : State Tax Commissioner

REPORT OF TAX COMMISSIONER STATEMENT NO. 5. ROLLING STOCK ASSESSMENT The rolling stock assessment of the various railroads is made by the State Board of Equalization and Assessment in accordance with Section 77-616, Compiled Statutes of Nebraska for 1929. The amount so found is divided by the total number of miles, giving the total valuation per mile, and this amount is multiplied by the number of miles in each city or village. This amount is then certified to the County Clerk to be added to the assessment of terminal property •which is made by the local assessor and then equalized by the State Board.
